thread.title: Comment on KSR Asks: Who is your favorite former Wildcat? by Shawn Kemp
thread.title_full: Comment on KSR Asks: Who is your favorite former Wildcat? by Shawn Kemp

author: Shawn Kemp
title: Comment on KSR Asks: Who is your favorite former Wildcat? by Shawn Kemp
text:
Posted in Basketball , Main | 47 Responses 
Back with another edition of KSR Asks with the Kentucky basketball team. This time, we asked each player to name their favorite former Wildcat . 
Most of the answers were predictable, but I could give you a hundred guesses to name Poythress‚Äô favorite and I‚Äôm certain you wouldn‚Äôt get it. Article written by Drew Franklin I can recite every line from Forrest Gump, blindfolded. Follow me on Twitter: @DrewFranklinKSR 47 responses to ‚ÄúKSR Asks: Who is your favorite former Wildcat?‚Äù Elmer and Mildred Skaggs October 26, 2015 at 1:04   
We started coming to games in our thirties in the 1920‚Äôs. My all-time favorite Cat is Ming Yu Xiang and Mildred‚Äôs is Dick Harpoonian Ha! October 26, 2015 at 2:22 pm | Permalink 
You should root for Rod-ni. She‚Äôs not as busted as the other two. üòâ 
#EveryoneIsLaughingAtYou October 26, 2015 at 1:07   
Ralph Beard. October 26, 2015 at 1:07   
Jeff Sheppard!!! October 26, 2015 at 1:14   
Patrick Sparks October 26, 2015 at 1:15   
With out a doubt Patrick Patterson. CatsBy80 October 26, 2015 at 1:20   
boogie‚Ä¶ but jodie meeks is a close second. watching his unconscious performance at Tennessee was something I‚Äôll never forget. Tayshaun‚Äôs 5 3s against UNC was special, too. leon singleton October 26, 2015 at 1:22   
Cotton Nash sincitycat October 26, 2015 at 2:24 pm | Permalink 
Charles ‚ÄúKing Cotton‚Äù Nash, Pat Riley, Louie Dampier, Kenny Walker and Tony Delk in this order. chimichanga October 26, 2015 at 1:23   
Tayshaun Prince! October 26, 2015 at 1:24   
Should have asked for favorite player from each coaching era. Randy October 26, 2015 at 1:28   
Kids these days they never mention the GOAT himself Gimel Martinez. Tod Svoboda October 26, 2015 at 2:14 pm | Permalink 
Ummm, GOAT? Really!?! October 26, 2015 at 1:30   
Mine is Randall Cobb. October 26, 2015 at 1:34   
Murray couldn‚Äôt name one. Brian October 26, 2015 at 2:11 pm | Permalink 
Dad? October 26, 2015 at 1:34   
Boogie is my clear cut #1‚Ä¶ with MKG & PPatt a close #2 & #3 ukaLLDAY October 26, 2015 at 1:37   
Brandon Knight did a lot of damage his year there. That was coach Cal‚Äôs best coaching job, not a single NBA all star on that team. But I just remember Brandon putting in work from all 3 levels EFFICIENTLY! Suck a quick release from the 3 ‚Ä¶ it was special. That was my favorite year. That year is the one that gets forgotten. Cynthiana October 26, 2015 at 1:41   
Did not think I could love DHawk anymore until he said my man, Keith Bogans. Always been my favorite player‚Ä¶ Actually, Charles Matthews reminds me of him to this point, at BBM I noticed his defense and also him taking to the hoop. Shades of Keith in the back of my mind‚Ä¶ Cynthiana October 26, 2015 at 1:44 pm | Permalink 
taking the ball to the hoop** sorry about that. Runnin1footer October 26, 2015 at 1:42   
Rex Chapman!!! October 26, 2015 at 1:48   
Anthony Epps for me. Always on the court during crunch time and solid. October 26, 2015 at 1:49   
Cotton Nash is number 1 and Jamal Mashburn is a close second. Davidichka October 26, 2015 at 1:51   
Tony Delk October 26, 2015 at 1:52   
Chuck Hayes has to be mentioned. john wall October 26, 2015 at 1:54   
John Wall.
